multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have discoloration on my back and chest that started as circles with red borders, but the redness has faded over time.
Have these patches of discoloration been itchy or painful?
No, they haven't been itchy or painful.
Have you noticed any changes in the texture or appearance of your hair, nails, or skin elsewhere on your body?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in the texture or appearance of my hair, nails, or skin elsewhere on my body.
Do you have a history of similar skin issues, or does anyone in your family have a history of skin diseases?
I am only describing my current symptoms, and I don't have information about any personal or family history of similar skin issues.
Have these patches changed in size or multiplied over time?
No, they have not changed in size or multiplied over time.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I am not taking any medication and do not have any other medical conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Tinea Versicolor
